Tomcat seems to support UTF-8 (and all the other encodings included in the JDK) 
for me.  The error message you are getting ("Cannot read file:  ze file")implies 
that you are trying to read a file named "ze file" that does not exist.

If the problem were really with the encoding, you would get a different 
exception.  For example, if I try to create a page with:

  <%@ page contentType="text/html;charset=xyzzy" %>

I get an exception like this:

  org.apache.jasper.JasperException:  Unsupported encoding: xyzzy
